## BetterVis_Ridgeline_Single

A ridgeline plot is an ideal choice for visualizing and comparing the distribution of a variable across multiple categories.

### Data Input
```r
# Create sample data
# In your project: data("BetterVis_Ridgeline_Single_example", package="BetterVis")
set.seed(123)
df_ridge_single <- data.frame(
  CytoTRACEScore = rnorm(200, 0.5, 0.2),
  patient = factor(rep(paste("Patient", 1:14), length.out = 200)),
  mutationGroup = factor(sample(c("Mut A", "Mut B", "Mut C", "WT"), 200, replace = TRUE))
)

sampleColor <- c('#F6EB5E','#CD8280','#F0F0F0', '#54D0B4',
                 '#D2D1D1','#78C3ED', '#E69F00', '#CBDFF3',
                 '#3BFFB8', '#ECAD67','#B3B2B2',
                 '#959595', '#E98FBD','#2672B2')
```

### Simple Example
```r
# Note: eval=FALSE as the function is not provided in user files
BetterVis_Ridgeline_Single(
  data = df_ridge_single, x_var = "CytoTRACEScore", y_var = "patient", color = sampleColor,
  annotation = TRUE, annotation_var  = "mutationGroup", color_annotation_var = c("#68d0ce", "#f4a4c9", "#e09a2a", "#de6a73")
)
```
![](images/ridgeline_single_simple.png)

### Advanced Example
```r
# Note: eval=FALSE as the function is not provided in user files
BetterVis_Ridgeline_Single(
  data = df_ridge_single, x_var = "CytoTRACEScore", y_var = "patient", color = sampleColor,
  annotation = TRUE, annotation_var  = "mutationGroup", color_annotation_var = c("#68d0ce", "#f4a4c9", "#e09a2a", "#de6a73"),
  arrow = TRUE,  arrow_x1 = c(0.88, 0.12), arrow_x2 = c(1.12, -0.12), arrow_y1 = c(0.5, 0.5), arrow_y2 = c(0.5, 0.5), arrow_width = 0.6,
  arrow_text_left = "Left", arrow_text_middle = "Middle", arrow_text_right = "Right",
  all_text_adjust = 1, combined_width=c(1.5, 0.8)
)
```
![](images/ridgeline_single_advanced.png)

## BetterVis_Ridgeline_Facet

A dedicated function specifically for creating faceted versions of ridgeline plots.

### Data Input
```r
# Create sample data
# In your project: data("BetterVis_Ridgeline_Facet_example", package="BetterVis")
set.seed(456)
df_ridge_facet <- data.frame(
  CytoTRACEScore = rnorm(500, 0.5, 0.2),
  patient = factor(rep(paste("Patient", 1:14), length.out = 500)),
  mutationGroup = factor(sample(c("Mut A", "Mut B", "Mut C", "WT"), 500, replace = TRUE)),
  Group = factor(sample(paste("Group", 1:6), 500, replace = TRUE))
)
```

### Simple Example
```r
# Note: eval=FALSE as the function is not provided in user files
BetterVis_Ridgeline_Facet(
  data = df_ridge_facet, x_var = "CytoTRACEScore", y_var = "patient", facet_var = "Group", annotation_var = "mutationGroup",
  color = sampleColor
)
```

### Advanced Example
```r
# Note: eval=FALSE as the function is not provided in user files
BetterVis_Ridgeline_Facet(
  data = df_ridge_facet, x_var = "CytoTRACEScore", y_var = "patient",
  facet_var = "Group", nrow = 2, ncol = 3,
  color = sampleColor,
  annotation = TRUE, annotation_var = "mutationGroup", color_annotation_var = c("#68d0ce", "#f4a4c9", "#4955d0", "#e09a2a", "#de6a73"),
  all_text_adjust = 1.1,
  combined_width = c(1.5, 0.8)
)
```
